main event: A civilian in Brownsville, Texas reported seeing an unidentified flying object on May 16, 1964 at around 10:02 PM.
interesting points: The object was observed through ground-radar and was seen moving slowly, straight, and then disappearing to the south.
The witness reported that the object was similar in shape and color to a star, but it was stationary and at a high altitude.
The witness and their wife observed the object for 10-20 minutes, and no noise was noted.
The witness had previously seen a U.S. made orbiting satellite 3 or 4 years ago, which they initially thought this object might be.
The report was submitted to the U.S. Air Force in September 1964.
sighted object: a stationary, star-like object in the sky
